intro: Acleisanthes angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Acleisanthes angustifolia is adapted to drought conditions and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
